reviews.review: These headphones pleasantly surprised me. The sound is clear and powerful, with good bass. The Bluetooth connection is fast and stable, and the ENC noise cancellation works very well for calls. The battery lasts a long time, and the LED display on the case is very convenient for checking the charge level.  They're also comfortable and water-resistant, making them ideal for everyday use. A great purchase for the price.

Comfortable and lightweight earbuds with good sound and a stable Bluetooth connection. The battery lasts a long time, and the LED display on the charging case is a nice touch for monitoring the charge level. Ideal for everyday use due to their price and functionality.

Excellent earbuds for the price! The sound quality is clear with strong bass, and the Bluetooth connection is fast and stable. I really like the LED digital display on the charging case—it makes it easy to see the battery level. They are comfortable to wear, even for long periods, and stay in place during workouts and running. The noise canceling works well for calls, and the battery life is impressive. Waterproof design is a big plus. Great value and highly recommended!

These wireless earbuds are an excellent value for the price. They connect quickly with Bluetooth 5.4 and stay stable during workouts and daily use. The sound quality is surprisingly clear with good bass, and calls come through loud and clear. I really like the LED digital display on the charging case—it makes it easy to check battery levels at a glance. Comfortable to wear for long periods and the battery life lasts all day. Highly recommended for work, running, or everyday listening.

Very good earbuds. They connect quickly with Bluetooth 5.3 and the sound is clear with good bass. The battery lasts a long time and the LED display is very useful. They are comfortable, water-resistant, and the noise cancellation works well for calls. Excellent value for the price.

The headphones shown in the image are the Fhumsh Wireless Headphones. These in-ear earbuds are popular on Amazon for their value and features such as Bluetooth 5.3 or higher connectivity, a charging case with a digital LED display, and IPX7 water resistance. They utilize Bluetooth 5.3 or 5.4 technology for a stable, low-latency connection. They offer up to 6-8 hours of playback on a single charge, and the charging case provides additional charges for a total of up to 50 hours of use. They feature touch controls for managing music, calls, and the voice assistant. They provide high-fidelity (Hi-Fi) stereo sound and, in many models, environmental noise cancellation (ENC) for clear calls. They are rated IPX7, making them sweatproof and splashproof, ideal for workouts.

I am very happy with these earbuds. The sound is clear and powerful, with good bass, and the Bluetooth connection is fast and stable. They are very comfortable to wear, even for long periods of time, and the battery lasts a long time. The design is nice and easy to carry. Definitely a great value for the price. I highly recommend them.

I loved these headphones. The sound is clear and powerful, with good bass, and the Bluetooth connection is fast and stable from the first use. They are very comfortable, even after several hours, and fit well to the ear without falling off. The battery lasts a long time and the case is practical for charging them at any time. They work great for calls, music and videos. Excellent option for the price, totally recommended.

La pantalla se ve muy bien, es ligera y cómoda incluso para usarla todo el día, y la batería dura varios días sin necesidad de cargarla.Me gusta mucho el seguimiento de actividad y salud, especialmente para llevar control de pasos y sueño. product_name: Lenovo TWS Earbuds Yoga PC Edition Cosmic Blue Active Noise Cancellation Bluetooth 5.3 Wireless Earbuds ENC 3-Mic Clear Calls AI EQ Mode Switch for Gaming, Movies, Music, and Meetings

reviews.review: They sound great, they're very comfortable and don't hurt your ears, and the noise cancellation is awesome! Only drawbacks is the suction piece can turn inside out when removing from ear, and the button can be super sensitive and be affected by your hair.

I gave these a good run through and have some thoughts. I'll start with the negatives. First, these do not sound great for music. It doesn't matter how I've EQ'ed them, I could never get the bass to a level I liked. These are mainly heavy on the highs with a lack of detail in the mids. Their sound signature, even after EQ'ing, works well for calls but didn't sound great with music or music-heavy movies. Second, Lenovo doesn't make an app for Android, iOS, macOS, or anything other than Windows. You must download Lenovo's Windows app to update their firmware, adjust settings, and EQ them. Third, their touch controls are limited. There’s a glossy strip on the earbuds that seem like they’d be great for volume controls, but they only have basic tap controls that are wonky. Fourth, Atmos sounds terrible. Like every other company that tries to upscale stereo audio to faux surround sound, the results are awful sounding, and I left Atmos off. Lastly, their ANC is on par with $40 earbuds from competing brands. It’s nice that Lenovo offers ANC, but it isn’t anything to write home about and it had issues with my space heater, something earbuds from other companies (even at $40) had no issues cancelling out.Despite these negatives, there are a few positives that make these a solid purchase for PC use. They maintain a solid connection to my Lenovo and Dell PCs. I could stay within a 10ft radius without experiencing dropouts or skips, even when in Teams meetings. I didn’t have anyone complain about microphone quality or other issues. The microphone tech here was able to cancel out the space heater in my office along with other low office noises.Latency was low enough I could watch training videos and other videos without having lip sync delays. My Lenovo has Bluetooth 5.3, but my work-issued Dell system has Bluetooth 5.1 and latency was still low with it. Lenovo’s app is easy to use once you get it installed, and it always connects to the earbuds without issues. The EQ was easy to adjust from a list of pre-sets or a simple band EQ you can adjust. Like I said, I could never get the bass levels I wanted or clarity in the highs, but having an EQ is better than not (I’m looking at you, Apple).The case doesn’t have Qi charging, I wish it would, but USB C charging was quick. These earbuds were getting me about 5 hours of use with ANC on, Lenovo advertises up 7 hours without ANC enabled. Much to my surprise, these earbuds feature wear detection. It’s a simple light sensor, but it works. Take one earbud out while playing content and it will pause. You can use the earbuds independently as well.Overall, these aren’t bad if you’re looking for a pair of inexpensive earbuds to use for Teams meetings. They aren’t great for music or movies, but they’re still serviceable. These excel with calls and meetings while providing a solid connection to Windows PCs during Teams meetings, something other earbuds have issues with. I don’t recommend these for media consumption, but they are great “business” earbuds to get work done.

I got these because of my laptop and initially I thought they were good headphones/earbuds for like the first week but it has been a nightmare to use these. I can only get one or the other side to connect to blue tooth. I finally fixed that and got both sides to sync together and connect to Bluetooth and within less than a week it went back to me only been able to hear from one ear bud at a time. I am not connecting it to other devices!!!! It should not be so challenging to reset the earbuds and get them both synced up and they should not revert back to only one ear bud working at time. I wish I would have returned them during the time frame to get refund or replacement but snoozed off hoping to fix them. I am disappointed. I have spent too many hours trying to resolve this and when I did it went back to not functioning as intended within days.

Really like these earbuds. They’re super comfortable and easy to use.I especially like that I can connect them to both my phone and my computer at the same time.When I’m watching something on my laptop and someone calls me, the earbuds automatically switch to the phone. That’s really convenient. Totally happy with the purchase!
These headphones are actually really good; the noise cancellation on them is amazing and the audio quality is pretty good. i highly recommend them.
The left ear buds stopped working within 3 months of purchase.Waste of my money

If you want cheaper ear buds, these are just ok. Battery will last max 2-hrs and audio quality is just ok. I used them for about a year and they still work, but I just purchased a nicer pair, different brand for almost double the price. You get what you pay for. I could never figure out how to control noise cancellation vs pass through audio.

I really wanted to like these earbuds.  They are a nice color, not the usual black.  The case is well made, though I would have liked a feel that was less slick, and a squared off base so it could set up on my desk.  They last about 4 hours listening to videos and audio books.  I am not one to use noise cancelling, I like to hear what is going on around me, but I did test it and there was a significant reduction in the noise in my office.  The instructions were a little lacking, there were pictures that told how to turn the earbuds and noise cancelling on/off.  I can supposedly register the earbuds, but do not see the serial number, and the only QR code on the box does not scan with my phone.  There was also mention of an app for further adjustments and updates to the earbuds, but after much searching I found it is an app for a computer, not cellphone.  This is very disappointing since I would be primarily using them at work and cannot download an app to my work computer.  After trying them out at work for 8 hours (you can use 1 bud at a time), I found them uncomfortable.  They fit very similarly to the newer apple buds, which I can't wear for the same reason.  The sound was ok.  With lower voices I didn't notice any issues, but the audio book I was listening to has a female narrator, and sounded a little tinny.  The app is supposed to allow you to make adjustments, but I cannot verify that.

Third, their touch controls are limited. There’s a glossy strip on the earbuds that seem like they’d be great for volume controls, but they only have basic tap controls that are wonky. Fourth, Atmos sounds terrible. Like every other company that tries to upscale stereo audio to faux surround sound, the results are awful sounding, and I left Atmos off. Lastly, their ANC is on par with $40 earbuds from competing brands. It’s nice that Lenovo offers ANC, but it isn’t anything to write home about and it had issues with my space heater, something earbuds from other companies (even at $40) had no issues cancelling out.Despite these negatives, there are a few positives that make these a solid purchase for PC use. They maintain a solid connection to my Lenovo and Dell PCs. I could stay within a 10ft radius without experiencing dropouts or skips, even when in Teams meetings. I didn’t have anyone complain about microphone quality or other issues. The microphone tech here was able to cancel out the space heater in my office along with other low office noises.Latency was low enough I could watch training videos and other videos without having lip sync delays. My Lenovo has Bluetooth 5.3, but my work-issued Dell system has Bluetooth 5.1 and latency was still low with it. Lenovo’s app is easy to use once you get it installed, and it always connects to the earbuds without issues. The EQ was easy to adjust from a list of pre-sets or a simple band EQ you can adjust. Like I said, I could never get the bass levels I wanted or clarity in the highs, but having an EQ is better than not (I’m looking at you, Apple).The case doesn’t have Qi charging, I wish it would, but USB C charging was quick. These earbuds were getting me about 5 hours of use with ANC on, Lenovo advertises up 7 hours without ANC enabled. Much to my surprise, these earbuds feature wear detection. It’s a simple light sensor, but it works. Take one earbud out while playing content and it will pause. You can use the earbuds independently as well.Overall, these aren’t bad if you’re looking for a pair of inexpensive earbuds to use for Teams meetings. They aren’t great for music or movies, but they’re still serviceable. These excel with calls and meetings while providing a solid connection to Windows PCs during Teams meetings, something other earbuds have issues with. I don’t recommend these for media consumption, but they are great “business” earbuds to get work done.

I got these because of my laptop and initially I thought they were good headphones/earbuds for like the first week but it has been a nightmare to use these. I can only get one or the other side to connect to blue tooth. I finally fixed that and got both sides to sync together and connect to Bluetooth and within less than a week it went back to me only been able to hear from one ear bud at a time. I am not connecting it to other devices!!!! It should not be so challenging to reset the earbuds and get them both synced up and they should not revert back to only one ear bud working at time. I wish I would have returned them during the time frame to get refund or replacement but snoozed off hoping to fix them. I am disappointed. I have spent too many hours trying to resolve this and when I did it went back to not functioning as intended within days.

Really like these earbuds. They’re super comfortable and easy to use.I especially like that I can connect them to both my phone and my computer at the same time.When I’m watching something on my laptop and someone calls me, the earbuds automatically switch to the phone. That’s really convenient. Totally happy with the purchase!
These headphones are actually really good; the noise cancellation on them is amazing and the audio quality is pretty good. i highly recommend them.
The left ear buds stopped working within 3 months of purchase.Waste of my money

If you want cheaper ear buds, these are just ok. Battery will last max 2-hrs and audio quality is just ok. I used them for about a year and they still work, but I just purchased a nicer pair, different brand for almost double the price. You get what you pay for. I could never figure out how to control noise cancellation vs pass through audio.

I really wanted to like these earbuds.  They are a nice color, not the usual black.  The case is well made, though I would have liked a feel that was less slick, and a squared off base so it could set up on my desk.  They last about 4 hours listening to videos and audio books.  I am not one to use noise cancelling, I like to hear what is going on around me, but I did test it and there was a significant reduction in the noise in my office.  The instructions were a little lacking, there were pictures that told how to turn the earbuds and noise cancelling on/off.  I can supposedly register the earbuds, but do not see the serial number, and the only QR code on the box does not scan with my phone.  There was also mention of an app for further adjustments and updates to the earbuds, but after much searching I found it is an app for a computer, not cellphone.  This is very disappointing since I would be primarily using them at work and cannot download an app to my work computer.  After trying them out at work for 8 hours (you can use 1 bud at a time), I found them uncomfortable.  They fit very similarly to the newer apple buds, which I can't wear for the same reason.  The sound was ok.  With lower voices I didn't notice any issues, but the audio book I was listening to has a female narrator, and sounded a little tinny.  The app is supposed to allow you to make adjustments, but I cannot verify that.

product_name: Soundcore P31i by Anker, Real-Time Adaptive Noise Cancelling, Hi-Res Sound, Translation Earbuds, 50H Playtime, Wireless Earbuds, Bluetooth Earphones, Spatial Audio, Fast Charging, IP55

reviews.review: The Soundcore P31i earbuds by Anker truly impressed me. The sound quality is clear, rich, and powerful, with immersive spatial audio and excellent real-time adaptive noise cancelling. They fit comfortably in my ears, even during long listening sessions, and feel secure without causing discomfort.I’ve used Apple AirPods for years, but these earbuds have easily become my favorite. The Hi-Res sound, long 50-hour battery life, fast charging, and IP55 water resistance make them perfect for everyday use. Bluetooth connectivity is smooth, and the added translation feature is a great bonus.For the price, the quality is outstanding—easily one of the best values I’ve experienced in wireless earbuds. Highly recommended for anyone looking for premium features without the premium price.

These earbuds are great. Just got mind last week. They sound good especially for the price. The ANC works good and wind quieting is good. I use mine for walking my dogs they came fully charged and have 90 % after 4 hours of use. And finally nice bass, app works well and connect in about 1 second.

WOW! It takes a lot these days for a purchase to genuinely blow me away, especially in the age of the countless low priced, questionable quality “audiophile grade” true wireless options out there. I have a pair on Sennheisser HD660s and Grado sr80s powered through a Fiios K5 Pro for at home listening. I needed something for the gym, being out and about, and most importantly travel.THESE THINGS ARE THE BEST TRUE WIRELESS EAR BUDS I HAVE EVER USED. Greatly prefer these to AirPods. I was expecting just a decent sounding pair of Bluetooth earbuds and had proper expectations for the super low price of these. What I got is something that has to be experienced to convey just how awesome these things are.Quick Pros/Things That Jumped Out-Extremely comfortable fit with a wide range of sizes for every ear canal > the App literally will run a test to check if you have a proper seal to ensure the best sound-THE APP! This is what has blown me away the most. This thing is BEAUTIFULLY designed and has some of the coolest features I have ever seen implemented in Bluetooth headphones:-running a hearing test to tell each separate ear’s overall health when it comes to noise exposure and being able to pick up frequencies-Ability to toggle between different modes(music, spatial, movie, games)-Ability to adjust the degree of active noise cancellation, including different modes such as adaptive which will automatically adjust, being able to amplify sounds coming from a TV in the background for example, being able to have a conversation without pausing your music-THE EQ IS SO IMPRESSIVE. It runs a series of A B tests to determine your distinct sound preferences to multiple variations of the same song where you choose if either A or B sounds better.-Connection is effortless, the buttons are not only easy to actually use on the ear buds, but they are fully customizable-COMFORT. I have been wearing these for 5 hours now and I’m not exaggerating when I say I don’t even notice them. Haven’t had to take them out a single time to let my “ears breathe”-Super durable build. Was surprised by the heft of the case and buds themselves-MOST IMPORTANT OF ALL- The sound quality is simply unparalleled as far as Bluetooth buds go. I would buy these for $200 without question. The EQ makes it so no matter your preference, you can tweak the sound to exactly how you like it. The fidelity, clarity, bass, highs, vocals, etc all shine.This is one of the best purchases I have made in years and could not be more pleased

I upgraded to the P31i from  the P30i and the difference is dramatic in every respect. More refined sound quality, a giant leap in Noise Cancellation,  ergonomics of tapping have improved significantly, connection speed...basically in every respect a vast improvement. Definitely worth the upgrade, especially for the incredibly cheap price they are being offered for.I give them 4 stars though for one reason: The darned case. It's horrible. Soundcore must have put together a design group with the challenge to create the worst possible case for these otherwise brilliant earphones. The surface is slippery like a small bar of wet soap. The case is jet black and top and bottom are exactly the same other than a microscopic and virtually invisible Soundcore logo on top. The catch to open it is also very small and uncomfortable so the soap case can slip out of your hands. I had to paint a big white dot on the top left hand corner to orient myself and use extreme caution every time I open the case. A shame for what are otherwise such brilliant earphones.

The Soundcore P31i by Anker delivers outstanding quality for both music and calls. The Hi-Res LDAC audio is crisp, with deep bass and clear vocals, making every track enjoyable. Connectivity is seamless — pairing is instant, and multipoint support makes switching between devices effortless. Comfort is excellent too: the lightweight design and snug fit make them easy to wear for hours without fatigue. Durability is impressive: the IP55 rating keeps them safe from sweat and rain, and the sturdy case feels built to last. Adaptive noise cancelling works brilliantly in different environments, while the real-time translation feature adds unique value for travel. With long battery life and fast charging, these earbuds are reliable for everyday use. Overall, they combine premium sound, comfort, smart features, and rugged design at a great price.

Identified and paired easily with Samsung Galaxy 25+.  Clean sound with good bass and clear clean sound.  Blocks out ambient noise very well.  Fit is good in ears and secure working in the yard.  Have not had any problems with moderate sweat. I recommend for general music.  I ha not done a phone call but sure that it will be the same quality.

product_name: Lenovo TWS Earbuds Yoga PC Edition Cosmic Blue Active Noise Cancellation Bluetooth 5.3 Wireless Earbuds ENC 3-Mic Clear Calls AI EQ Mode Switch for Gaming, Movies, Music, and Meetings

reviews.review: They sound great, they're very comfortable and don't hurt your ears, and the noise cancellation is awesome! Only drawbacks is the suction piece can turn inside out when removing from ear, and the button can be super sensitive and be affected by your hair.

I gave these a good run through and have some thoughts. I'll start with the negatives. First, these do not sound great for music. It doesn't matter how I've EQ'ed them, I could never get the bass to a level I liked. These are mainly heavy on the highs with a lack of detail in the mids. Their sound signature, even after EQ'ing, works well for calls but didn't sound great with music or music-heavy movies. Second, Lenovo doesn't make an app for Android, iOS, macOS, or anything other than Windows. You must download Lenovo's Windows app to update their firmware, adjust settings, and EQ them. Third, their touch controls are limited. There’s a glossy strip on the earbuds that seem like they’d be great for volume controls, but they only have basic tap controls that are wonky. Fourth, Atmos sounds terrible. Like every other company that tries to upscale stereo audio to faux surround sound, the results are awful sounding, and I left Atmos off. Lastly, their ANC is on par with $40 earbuds from competing brands. It’s nice that Lenovo offers ANC, but it isn’t anything to write home about and it had issues with my space heater, something earbuds from other companies (even at $40) had no issues cancelling out.Despite these negatives, there are a few positives that make these a solid purchase for PC use. They maintain a solid connection to my Lenovo and Dell PCs. I could stay within a 10ft radius without experiencing dropouts or skips, even when in Teams meetings. I didn’t have anyone complain about microphone quality or other issues. The microphone tech here was able to cancel out the space heater in my office along with other low office noises.Latency was low enough I could watch training videos and other videos without having lip sync delays. My Lenovo has Bluetooth 5.3, but my work-issued Dell system has Bluetooth 5.1 and latency was still low with it. Lenovo’s app is easy to use once you get it installed, and it always connects to the earbuds without issues. The EQ was easy to adjust from a list of pre-sets or a simple band EQ you can adjust. Like I said, I could never get the bass levels I wanted or clarity in the highs, but having an EQ is better than not (I’m looking at you, Apple).The case doesn’t have Qi charging, I wish it would, but USB C charging was quick. These earbuds were getting me about 5 hours of use with ANC on, Lenovo advertises up 7 hours without ANC enabled. Much to my surprise, these earbuds feature wear detection. It’s a simple light sensor, but it works. Take one earbud out while playing content and it will pause. You can use the earbuds independently as well.Overall, these aren’t bad if you’re looking for a pair of inexpensive earbuds to use for Teams meetings. They aren’t great for music or movies, but they’re still serviceable. These excel with calls and meetings while providing a solid connection to Windows PCs during Teams meetings, something other earbuds have issues with. I don’t recommend these for media consumption, but they are great “business” earbuds to get work done.

I got these because of my laptop and initially I thought they were good headphones/earbuds for like the first week but it has been a nightmare to use these. I finally fixed that and got both sides to sync together and connect to Bluetooth and within less than a week it went back to me only been able to hear from one ear bud at a time. I am not connecting it to other devices!!!! It should not be so challenging to reset the earbuds and get them both synced up and they should not revert back to only one ear bud working at time. I wish I would have returned them during the time frame to get refund or replacement but snoozed off hoping to fix them. I am disappointed. I have spent too many hours trying to resolve this and when I did it went back to not functioning as intended within days.

Really like these earbuds. These headphones are actually really good; the noise cancellation on them is amazing and the audio quality is pretty good. i highly recommend them.

I really wanted to like these earbuds.  They are a nice color, not the usual black.  The case is well made, though I would have liked a feel that was less slick, and a squared off base so it could set up on my desk.  They last about 4 hours listening to videos and audio books.  I am not one to use noise cancelling, I like to hear what is going on around me, but I did test it and there was a significant reduction in the noise in my office.  The instructions were a little lacking, there were pictures that told how to turn the earbuds and noise cancelling on/off.  I can supposedly register the earbuds, but do not see the serial number, and the only QR code on the box does not scan with my phone.  There was also mention of an app for further adjustments and updates to the earbuds, but after much searching I found it is an app for a computer, not cellphone.  This is very disappointing since I would be primarily using them at work and cannot download an app to my work computer.  After trying them out at work for 8 hours (you can use 1 bud at a time), I found them uncomfortable.  They fit very similarly to the newer apple buds, which I can't wear for the same reason.  The sound was ok.  With lower voices I didn't notice any issues, but the audio book I was listening to has a female narrator, and sounded a little tinny.  The app is supposed to allow you to make adjustments, but I cannot verify that.

reviews.review: I recently purchased the LEEMC Wireless Earbuds and they have exceeded my expectations, particularly regarding functionality and design.Key Highlights:• Smart Touch Screen Case: The ability to control noise cancellation settings and monitor battery life directly from the case is incredibly efficient. product_name: Lenovo TWS Earbuds Yoga PC Edition Cosmic Blue Active Noise Cancellation Bluetooth 5.3 Wireless Earbuds ENC 3-Mic Clear Calls AI EQ Mode Switch for Gaming, Movies, Music, and Meetings

reviews.review: They sound great, they're very comfortable and don't hurt your ears, and the noise cancellation is awesome! Only drawbacks is the suction piece can turn inside out when removing from ear, and the button can be super sensitive and be affected by your hair.

I gave these a good run through and have some thoughts. I'll start with the negatives. First, these do not sound great for music. It doesn't matter how I've EQ'ed them, I could never get the bass to a level I liked. These are mainly heavy on the highs with a lack of detail in the mids. Their sound signature, even after EQ'ing, works well for calls but didn't sound great with music or music-heavy movies. Second, Lenovo doesn't make an app for Android, iOS, macOS, or anything other than Windows. You must download Lenovo's Windows app to update their firmware, adjust settings, and EQ them. Third, their touch controls are limited. There’s a glossy strip on the earbuds that seem like they’d be great for volume controls, but they only have basic tap controls that are wonky. Fourth, Atmos sounds terrible. Like every other company that tries to upscale stereo audio to faux surround sound, the results are awful sounding, and I left Atmos off. Lastly, their ANC is on par with $40 earbuds from competing brands. It’s nice that Lenovo offers ANC, but it isn’t anything to write home about and it had issues with my space heater, something earbuds from other companies (even at $40) had no issues cancelling out.Despite these negatives, there are a few positives that make these a solid purchase for PC use. They maintain a solid connection to my Lenovo and Dell PCs. I could stay within a 10ft radius without experiencing dropouts or skips, even when in Teams meetings. I didn’t have anyone complain about microphone quality or other issues. The microphone tech here was able to cancel out the space heater in my office along with other low office noises.Latency was low enough I could watch training videos and other videos without having lip sync delays. My Lenovo has Bluetooth 5.3, but my work-issued Dell system has Bluetooth 5.1 and latency was still low with it. Lenovo’s app is easy to use once you get it installed, and it always connects to the earbuds without issues. The EQ was easy to adjust from a list of pre-sets or a simple band EQ you can adjust. Like I said, I could never get the bass levels I wanted or clarity in the highs, but having an EQ is better than not (I’m looking at you, Apple).The case doesn’t have Qi charging, I wish it would, but USB C charging was quick. These earbuds were getting me about 5 hours of use with ANC on, Lenovo advertises up 7 hours without ANC enabled. Much to my surprise, these earbuds feature wear detection. It’s a simple light sensor, but it works. Take one earbud out while playing content and it will pause. You can use the earbuds independently as well.Overall, these aren’t bad if you’re looking for a pair of inexpensive earbuds to use for Teams meetings. They aren’t great for music or movies, but they’re still serviceable. These excel with calls and meetings while providing a solid connection to Windows PCs during Teams meetings, something other earbuds have issues with. I don’t recommend these for media consumption, but they are great “business” earbuds to get work done.
